website_summaries.verdict: The best budget, beginner-friendly camera flash compatible with all major camera brands.
pros: Flash contains a simple interface and settings menu to get the lighting correct with minimal effort
Flash head angles from 0 to 270 degrees
Offers a good amount of flexibility for different light intensities
cons: The plastic exterior is prone to damage and scratching if used in rough shooting situations

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product to someone in the same position as ...
customer_reviews.text: My biggest fear was shooting in broad daylight. I was intimated by shadows and knew nothing about lighting. I didn't have the time given the ideal of my sessions, to set up off camera flash. So I invested in a couple products. The middle right and bottom left are both created with ONLY this product. The bottom right is created with this product AND a flash diffuser made by the same company. I highly recommend this product to someone in the same position as me. It's half the price of other speedlites and works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Brandalin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love this. My room is usually dark and photos look bad but with this flash they look so professional and well lit.
customer_reviews.author: Izabela

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this light! Not sure how I ever shot a wedding without it! The wedding in the pictures, the reception lighting was actually super dark and yellow, but with this flash it made all the difference! The couple loved their photos!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Torres

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Taking into consideration the price, this product is out of this world, AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! This gave me such perfect lighting, it was easy to install and the quality was beyond the price of the item. The only downside I can give is that if you want to take multiple pictures in a row, occasionaly the flash won't go off. This may be the case for other external flashes as well though. Either way, I can't complain and I would definitely recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Tellep

customer_reviews.title: Look no further excellent results.
customer_reviews.text: If i had more than 5 stars i would give it. This manual flash is all you need for both professional and beginners. Learn how to use manual flash and you will have excellent results. This flash unit is the best one I've owned so far and is far less than what i paid for my 2 other flashes. This one is a definate keeper and the reviews are real about it buy it with confidence, go out and buy more than one like I'm getting ready to do.
customer_reviews.author: Trusted One

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Wouldn't sync to my Canon Rebel T5i
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't sync to my Canon Rebel T5i. Also wouldn't stay in the hot shoe. The test button worked great.....
customer_reviews.author: Mae Godwin

customer_reviews.title: Works well but can't use LCD screen when in use.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all. A word of advice. It was not working for me at first with my Canon T6i or 60D. After numerous testing I figured it out. If it's not working on your camera, you have to first turn your camera to "manual" then turn the display off. Then the flash works. For some reason, it would not flash when I had the display screen on. However, right after you take the picture, it will still display on your screen for 3 seconds. You just do not have the ability to live view through the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Jafrich

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and price but not 100% compatible with Canon SX50HS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flash for my Canon SX50HS. It is very good quality and I was quite pleased with my initial impression. It fit perfectly and was functional. Sadly I had to return it because I could only get it to work in AUTO mode. I often change camera modes to M, AV or P and need to set the flash to trigger, but it simply didn't work. While the mounting shoe may be standard, it does not mean it's 100% compatible with this camera, in my experience. The other issue was the weight and size compared to the camera. It made the camera feel really heavy and cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! Shot a indoor event with this flash. It performed the way it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Laron Wright

customer_reviews.title: Good practice flash
customer_reviews.text: It works like a cheap manual strobe should. Light on features but for the price who cares? I use it for a little fill light and as a backup. Keep in mind these are really cheap. They are cheap for a reason: they are not exactly precision engineered. Mine came with a wonky on/off switch. Off works as expected. On also turns it off. To use it you have to turn it to on and then gently move it back toward off until it comes on. Other than this is a good, cheap light source to practice with off camera flash. Don't rely on it to photograph a wedding or someone famous.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Blakey

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Canon EOS Rebel T3i
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the explicit purpose of having a mounted flash for my Rebel T3i. Imagine my surprise when the item arrived and it does not work mounted to my T3i. I consistently get an error message. Not worth the money. Returning for a refund and will look for a better product that delivers on the promise.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and the price is too good to pass up.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic speedlite. I have two 600 exrt speedlites, and they're awesome work horses. The wireless capability is one of my favorite features. But the Neewer tt560 is a great solution for a back up. I use manual settings on my 600s anyway, so the Neewer does exactly what I need it to do. I actually used this as the main, and left the 600s in the bag for a reception yesterday. I'll be getting more of these for outdoor shoots where I have to blast full power. Then I'll use my 600s whenever I have indoor work, so I don't tire those out too soon.
customer_reviews.author: N8iv Angeleno

customer_reviews.title: Not good if you're taking a lot of photos quickly
customer_reviews.text: I had another Neewer Speedlite that I really loved, but the bulb burned out randomly after only a year. I thought I'd try a different model but same brand. This one does well for the first few pictures ... but then the charging takes FOREVER after each photo. I lose so many awesome shots because of this. I would return it but I threw the box away before using it thinking it would be fine. After this one and the other one burning out, I think I might personally avoid this brand in the future. Just be sure to test it out before throwing away the box.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Canon Rebels Newer models will most likely not work.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with the canon rebel T7. I followed the basic instructions, put my camera on manual and adjusted it to speed light settings. Still did not work! Seller needs to update and be very clear with what canon camera will work!!!!! After reading many reviews it seems most canon rebels will not work with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kiera L.

customer_reviews.title: Great little inexpensive flash
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive flash, this does a great job. I am currently using it as a second flash with a radio trigger to do water drop photos. It allows me the foot pad to set it on a table, wide angle diffuser, White pop up diffuser, increase/decrease flash power and also has adjustable head. If you want an auto flash with a hot shoe series of contacts to work with your cameras hot shoe, this isn't the flash you need. As the extra flash it works just great using that radio trigger to supplement light in the scene.
customer_reviews.author: BGH

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to help with wedding pictures on a Nikon 3100. About 70% of the pictures were blurry, over exposed or under exposed. I finally started to get a few good picks near the end of the event by bouncing the light off of a 20 foot high ceiling. It just did not work well with my camera. They did not appear to be in sync, and my built in flash kept popping up despite this flash being on the hot shoe. I should have went with a TTL.
customer_reviews.author: MCRS

customer_reviews.title: Works but not well enough to actually use.
customer_reviews.text: I got this flash to replace an older one that bit the dust. Getting back in to photography so I needed something to soften up my flash lighting. It does flash and you can manually adjust the flash strength. My issues with it are it is clunky and doesn't seem to fit properly in the hot shoe on my Canon T3 or T7i. It will not properly lock down, and is loose/clunky enough that I will not use it due to hassle, hence the 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: its great as a master, but as a slave not so much (or maybe I suck)
customer_reviews.text: The flash is very cheap for the reason it doesn't have TTL. Which means you gotta manually adjust the right amount of light output. This works great when you have it as master on your hotshoe. However when it is a slave flash, kind of hard to get it to sync. I have a a6500 and sony flash. For reason unknown, the camera is not able to capture Neewer's flash consistently and presents issues in the expected light scheme. Maybe its cuz i just don't know what I am doing, but I think i'll stick with the original manufacturer stuff. Really wish I could like this flash because its well built and solid. Just not working out for me
customer_reviews.author: CoopaPple

customer_reviews.title: Very complicated, poorly written instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Once you have this all set up, it works fairly well though I could never get all the flashes I ordered to work together. Notably, the instructions are nearly impossible to follow/decipher and are overall pretty limited. This seems like a good idea - low cost, decent product - but in reality just too complicated. There are much simpler and higher quality flashes out there that are worth spending the extra money on.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Flagg

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: You simply cannot go wrong with flash for the money! IMHO, this perhaps represents one of the greatest values for beginning flash photography. If the price holds, I may purchase 1 or 2 more and save them. I also have a more expensive flash that I can use with a trigger and other fancy features, but for a basic flash this one is the star. Someone tell Canon to put the center pin back onto their camera hotshoes so these kinds of flashes may be used. I'm a Canon guy, but looking at Sony because I want the capability of a menu of products such as this flash.
customer_reviews.author: CTSIA-100

customer_reviews.title: When it worked, it was great
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to speedlites, and flash in general. I bought this along with a flash diffuser. It works really well, but only when it wants to. I had mine on-camera (hotshoe) set to Manual. It would go off when I took a photo, but wouldn't go off for the next. It worked VERY sporadically. I changed the batteries multiple times and it didn't make a difference. Worked fine off-camera in S1 and S2 when triggered with my pop-up flash. I had to return it to get something else since I have to shoot a wedding this weekend and can't be without a flash.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: best budget flash for the money period
customer_reviews.text: let me first let everyone know im not ameteur photographer by any means you need this flash or the onboard flash will be dark in the background everybody should buy this this is coming from somebody that doesnt know anything about photography whatssoever this thing is easy i wrote a review before you probably saw my name on here before about the same review giving it a poor review i messed around with this for a long time and man am i impressed with this now. Think about what the potential what you can get out of this i havent tried it outside in the dark yet.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great light for amateurs
customer_reviews.text: Great light. Took me a little while to get used to it since it is my first flash. Especially understanding that your shutter speed needs to be at 1/250th of a second in order to capture the light. Otherwise he get this half light half dark look. I am an Amateur so there are many things I am picking up learning from my friends and YouTube. all and all a very good product. I will probably get another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Flash for the Price
customer_reviews.text: A great flash for the price. I'm not a beginner, but do photography more as a hobby for some occasional money on the side and don't have my own professional business, so I love this flash. It does great in whatever lighting I've tested it in so far, both outside and inside. It's easy to learn and easy to adjust on the fly if it's not bright enough or too bright. The only downside I've found is that it wobbles quite a bit on top of my camera, which makes me nervous. Other than that, it is wonderful and don't plan on upgrading any time soon!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the quality of this Flash module. It didn't feel cheap as many others out there in fact it feels premium. I tried the different power levels and that too was impressive. The flash would light up an entire room at the brightest setting and you can angle the light how ever you like. Overall great product. Make sure and buy the diffuser with it, adds even more value.
customer_reviews.author: andrea medford

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Flash died i got to use it maybe 5 times if that.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kichg

customer_reviews.title: For the price, what's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: getting new equipment and figuring out how effective it is can be expensive. This brand makes this process less daunting and enables you to discover the effects lighting has on your work and the impact and use of flash in your setup. It's great at doing what it does, but don't expect anything more or anything that might work on a "professional" level. That said, this flash works perfectly in all the situations i've tested it, the only variable that would truly impact the quality of work one produces is ones skill level at the end of the day. This flash allows you to get past the ticket shock of other brands and practice makes perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mat Higham

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible with Canon 6D Mark II
customer_reviews.text: I returned it, because it is NOT directly comparable with the Canon 6D mark II. Yes, the hot-shoe mount fits and if it’s connected and turned on, the flash will go off. However, there is no metering (which is huuuuge) and the timing is off. There are offsets you can set to make up for this, but the lack of metering is a deal breaker for me. The price difference is obviously huge, but you’re better off buying the Canon-brand speed lite and going from there.
customer_reviews.author: Droubs

customer_reviews.title: Great for off camera application.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a few uses. Very disappointed. When it worked it was great but it’s just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Santino

customer_reviews.title: An amazing product for the price
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product for the price. I have two of these and I'd face them off against a "high end" speedlite any day of the week. Very well made and versatile. You won't find anything better at this price point, or at a higher price point for that matter. If you're in the market for a flash, stop looking and buy this. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Khris Reaves

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap off-body solution.
customer_reviews.text: I got a Neewer NW320 for my A6000. Later I wanted to use it off-body for portraits but I couldn't get it to work with any of the "universal" wireless kits I tried because the contacts didn't line up right, and I didn't want to shell out the big bucks for a Sony-specific kit. I ended up getting this just for off body. It works well with the Neewer wireless kit. It's big and bulky but I won't be using it on body or in the field so whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Negative459Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great no frills flash
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to shoot my first wedding and its awesome. I've been using it for other things now too. I'm typically shooting on the lowest 3-4 levels of power, and the recharge rate is fantastic. It never misses a fire and I've tried it in both the hot shoe and as a slave triggered standalone light. Works well for both purposes, and unless you need fancy functions, this thing will get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are photographers with a growing business and this was definitely a necessity to our photography accessories. We really enjoy this light and the interface was very easy to learn and we have gotten great quality images from using it. This is definitely a budget-friendly item compared to other lights on the market. if you are wondering whether or not you should get this item, the answer is a clear yes from us! Buy it, enjoy it, and everyone else will too.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah and CoryTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome flash for starting out
customer_reviews.text: This was my first flash I had used and it was great for learning with. It did not cost much and is simple enough to use that you don't need to know much about photography to figure it out on your own. It has a solid build and comes with a small stand that allows it to be used off the camera without having a large tripod stand. It has all the features needed for a beginner, Id recommend it to anyone starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Medina

customer_reviews.title: I loved the one I bought so much I bought two more
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 1 of these TT560 flashes and was so happy that I bought 2 more. I use them with NPT-04 4 Channel Wireless Triggers on my Nikon D40 and D5300. I mount them to the hotshoe and they trigger perfectly. Very easy to adjust the light output level. On low to med they will trigger as fast as I can shoot. On med to High level they will trigger rapidly a couple times then need about 1-2 secs between shots. Not as powerful as a 120v speed flash but so much more portable and much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Annette G

customer_reviews.title: Invest in a better flash than this as it is not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Used it for one studio shoot and it made the batteries overheat and break. Now the flash doesn't even work. Invest in a better flash than this as it is not reliable, and the refresh time between shots is so long.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Will not function with Canon Camera External Flash Menu.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good flash for the price but you'll get no camera menu control of the flash so when they say standard hot shoe... Well I'd technically disagree. Doesn't have the 4 pin configuration Canon's use. Probably going to return it for a fully functional one. My bad for not reading the questions on Amazon or I would have realized.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S.

customer_reviews.title: Fair, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Refresh rate is alittle slow but hand to have in a pinch. A few more options for settings would be nice but for the price it is right on point. I give this item three stars not because it is low quality, but rather it can't compete with a 5star product and most people dont actually bother to read reviews. If you want high end, or are a professional that can't use a flash without meter and other itens to tell you how to set up this is wrong for you. If you know what you're doing or just want it for family photos it's worth the price but not much more.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Flash - Bang - Boom!
customer_reviews.text: My apologies for the corny title. This secondary flash works great without a hotshoe enabled digital camera. I set the Neewer to S2 in the "MODE" settings and it did not flash during the camera's pre-flash, but did give a big burst at the camera's real flash. Hope to post comparison pictures of basic still lifes with the Fuji s9900w flash vs the s9900w + the Neewer TT560 speedlite in the future. Awesome product for an unbelievably low price!
customer_reviews.author: squinja7000

customer_reviews.title: Missing mini stand, didn't work right away
customer_reviews.text: I knew it wasn't going to be the best but thought it would be a nice back up at weddings. I opened the box, took it out, put batteries in, and tried to turn it on, nothing. It did this a few times untill finally it turned on. Then looking through the box I find that the mini stand is missing. Well great, now I guess its an on camera flash only. You get what you pay for I guess. As a flash, it works. Not sure how fast it will burn through the batteries yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonse_Elric68

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon Rebel t6. You cannot control the flash from the menu as it is not a Canon product. It will communicate with your camper through a circuit, just by being in contact with the hot shoe, so making sure it on there properly is troubleshooting tip #1. Also, your shutter speed should be at least 1/160, but I found my pictures were half blacked out when I started hitting shutter speeds of 1/400 and 1/500. This is my first external flash and I am a beginner photographer, so I don’t know if the shutter speed thing is for all flashes or just this one
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We got this to use with our Canon M50. It is incredibly easy to use, both mounted on the hot shoe, and also as a separate "slave" flash. I am super new to photography, so i was assuming that i was going to need some sort of cable to fire the slave flash....but no, it just detects the primary flash from the camera and immediately fires. I also like that it has a diffuser and reflection card built into a hidden storage slot right above the bulb. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Lightningfrog27

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I was VERY wary about buying this because camera equipment can be iffy if you're buying it online. I was worried that it would only work once or wouldn't work at all, especially because of the low price. But I was pleasantly surprised! It works wonderfully and it makes my pictures look so much better compared to the flash that's already attached to my camera. Don't let the price deter you. This product works well! My only tip is that you buy good quality batteries so that it lasts longer. The last thing you want is for your flash to die midway through an event or photoshoot.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Great Flash for Frist Time Users
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid photographer in a little bit of everything. I purchased this flash mainly for a wedding I have coming up and I'm looking to have some extra light. I've never used one of these before and had no experience with it whatsoever. After just experimenting with it a few times it's super easy to figure it out. I do quite a bit of food photography and this was perfect! I was able to get a nice bright and sharp photo. I'm really looking forward to using this for portraits. I will update once I use it more and for longer periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Cheeba

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap flash
customer_reviews.text: I have six or seven of these flashes with remote triggers. They are great for fill lighting and learning how to work with multiple manual flashes. You can't change settings from the hot shoe trigger like pro equipment, but you don't pay $300+ per light either. They are decently bright, but you need at least three to get a good photo with the sun in the background (vs 1 Gordox AD200). Slave mode works well with indoor photos, but a little spotty outside. They are great to keep around and I've going them to perform better than the Amazon Basics flash (which at one point was the same price)
customer_reviews.author: Steve Farnell

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. Randomly won’t turn on.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a year, only used it a handful of times. Not great, but nothing to complain about, until suddenly THE NIGHT BEFORE A WEDDING it isn’t working. I always troubleshoot with my equipment the night before and it won’t even turn on. Tried multiple brands of batteries, brand new ones, fully charged recharable ones, no dice. I am SO pissed and frustrated as I (stupidly) don’t have a backup speedlight for tomorrow and will have to improvise with my LED panel. If I could give this 0 stars I would. I’ve taken care of my gear meticulously so I have absolutely no idea why this has happened.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Great for first AND backup flash!
customer_reviews.text: Had to pick up a simple yet reliable Flash unit. This did the job and it didn't pull that much power from the batteries! I used this with my Canon 70D and found the sweet spot settings. Level 3/4 on the SpeedLite with shutter speed from 1/130-160 and aperture at 6.5-7.1, and ISO at 2000-2500. This was used in a massive Ballroom that held about 225 people!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a manual flash!
customer_reviews.text: This is a manual only speed light! That means it is triggered by a flash from your camera. If you are not certain if your camera can trigger this flash, get the Neewar wireless trigger that fits onto this. It will also help you avoid the double flash. It works like it is supposed to. Learn to use these and you will save yourself time and money.
customer_reviews.author: JB Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy! Won't last if using them often.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for the 1st couple of months, but then slowly the base that connects to the camera became wobbly and not stable. It also stopped syncing and would have to be held and have pressure applied in order to flash when taking an image. And to top it all off this month the two we purchased have completely stopped working. One decided to explode internally during a wedding session and the other one just stopped working mid session at another wedding. Not a great investment that will last. Hoping the seller will take care of this. Until then 1 star is all it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this Mounted Flash
customer_reviews.text: I seriously can't believe I waited so long to get a flash. Makes it very easy to take pictures in the house, even at night. This flash is perfect. Sometimes it takes a while to fully charge for the picture, but I'm more than happy to wait. Since you can bounce the light off the ceiling and choose the strength of the flash, the pictures don't look poorly lit. The flash looks natural and I get a lot of people asking how I got such great pictures of my family at night or events in poorly lit places. For such a low price, this flash is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alethea Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this flash due to the reviews. Once I got it I started playing with it as I was planning on using it for an upcoming wedding shoot. It was an ok flash. Nothing fancy but did it's job. The day of the wedding, however, I had shot only 25-30 pics when all of a sudden the flash made a couple loud "cracks" and "pops" and stopped working. Luckily I got ahold of my friend and used her Nikon flash and finished out the day just fine. Needless to say, I was/am thoroughly disgusted with this product!! I guess it's true... "You get what you pay for"!
customer_reviews.author: GINA

customer_reviews.title: This flash is a great bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use my off camera flash often enough to warrant buying a high end model. I thought it was worth trying this flash first and I was pleasantly surprised. This flash is made of mostly plastic and not very sturdy. I have had one of the flashes fall completely apart, but only after 4 years of use. For the savings, I’m willing to buy a new flash every 4 years. I’ve bought multiples of this flash to use on multiple camera bodies at the same time and they’ve all been great.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: for the price, its a solid starter flash
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy this flash is to set up. It was my flash I purchased for use on my Sony a7ii. This flash is heavy due to it using four AA batteries. if you use it on the higher power settings you may find yourself taking pictures where the flash doesn't fire as it takes time to power back up. This is my one complaint. Other than that it's a solid flash. I use it in my studio and in dark venues as well as occasionally outside in very bright environments.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan DeLesDernier

customer_reviews.title: Great starter until you can afford name brand.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this for a few days & I’ve only done one actual shoot using it BUT so far I really like it. If anything changes I’ll update but for now, It’s great if you don’t have the $200-$500 to drop on a canon one right away, which I don’t. It takes 4 AA batteries but assuming it doesn’t drain them too quickly, that’s not too bad. It’s easy to work, easy to function & definitely packs a punch for such a cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: My first dedicated flash unit, so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Part of my love for this thing is simply having a dedicated flash, the improvement in quality is night and day (duh). But it is easy to use, easy to understand, and has great features like the slave function. At this price point, I think it delivers more than everything a beginner could want. Using on a Nikon D5100
customer_reviews.author: Pinch

customer_reviews.title: I've replaced all my flashes with Neewer flashes
customer_reviews.text: I have always used non-name brand flashes for my business. The ones I was using were about 1/2 the price of the name brand flashes, but they had all the features I needed. I had one of these fail and needed a replacement quickly. For the price I thought I would try one of these. Hands down it's better than the flashes I was using before and it's a LOT cheaper. I've purchased 3 more of these flashes to replace the other flash units I have.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic flash!
customer_reviews.text: Performed a lot better than I expected. I was expecting cheap results like my other cheap flashes, but this one is pretty semi-pro grade. Very bright, several brightness modes, works great with a remote flash and in slave mode. Also bright enough to get rid of shadows on faces when shooting outdoors on a sunny afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: J.M. Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable Dumb Slaves
customer_reviews.text: Great dumb slave. For $30, you just can’t beat these. I’ve got 3 of them that trigger from a pre-flash. So they don’t have iTTL and you adjust the manually, but I’m using them for backgrounds and one with a snoot for a hair light. Set for fill and shoot away. Great to have in the kit for those random fill needs too. Grab a few of these for the studio and mobile kits and for less that $100 you’ve got lots of fill and highlight options to enhance the Key and Fill.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Garvin

customer_reviews.title: Wow I Actually Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of this item only cause I've never used Neewer speed lights before and I don't know anyone that uses these but I could't pass on the price and I'm so glad I did. I use to use the Yongnuo Speedlights but I found these to be more my taste. Love the ON/OFF switch opposed to having to hold the button for 2 seconds on other speed lights.
customer_reviews.author: JoeInmotion

customer_reviews.title: Recycle Time Way To Slow
customer_reviews.text: I am a wedding photographer and I was looking at this product to provide off-camera fill light using a remote system I will start by saying it does produce a lot of light. The controls are easy to use. The reason I gave this product 3 stars is because of the recycle time. With brand new batteries (I tested the voltage just to make sure) it took 20-25 seconds to recycle before I could fire it again on 1/1 brightness. It took roughly 10 seconds at 1/4 brightness. This would be okay for an amateur for still photography, but it's a waste of money for portraiture.
customer_reviews.author: Sphoto

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Quality is terrific . Looks great and works great. Can’t ask for much more for a cheap flash. Neewer brand has not disappointed me yet with quite a handful of photography items I have bought from them. Im finding them to be pretty reliable for an inexpensive, affordable option over the big name brands.
customer_reviews.author: Will R

customer_reviews.title: Great Flash
customer_reviews.text: This is a great flash for my Canon T3. It worked flawlessly over the last month since I purchased it. It feels very robust and sturdy. I really like the flip-out diffuser and white reflector screen. For best results, I have been angling the flash almost straight up at the ceiling and turning the flash intensity all the way down.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. King

customer_reviews.title: Won't lock onto camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this external flash, especially for the price. However I was unable to use it because it would not lock onto my camera. I'm a very clumsy person and really need the protection a lock provides. There also aren't many options for settings compared to a higher end speedlight. I guess you get what you pay for. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is great if it's compatible for your camera's computer
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't clear to me if this would work with my camera and it didn't. I needed a TTL. I'm sure, this is great if it's compatible for your camera's computer. I returned this and got another Neewer speedlite that is TTL and it's amazing. I gave it 4 stars because it was good pricing and I'm sure the product worked as it was intended, but the product info wasn't clear... I have a Nikon D3000. This is a manual speedlite. If you want one that subs in for your camera's flash, you need a TTL. I had to do a LOT of internet digging to get that question answered.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Updegraff

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all
customer_reviews.text: I got this light and everything works but the flash itself I tested it with the button in the light would never flash and I put on my camera the flash would never work and it’s brand new open right out of the box and the flash would never work.. right out the box this flash doesn’t even work and saw many ppl say the same thing.. don’t waste ur money
customer_reviews.author: Amber Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beginner or those with a small budget.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap feel Light weight. However, it does what it's intended to do. For the price you can't argue much. You get what you pay for. I have the more expensive Yongnu for my Nikons, but didn't want to spend so much for my Olympus MFT set up as I don't use it for paid work. I paired this up with the Neewer remote system and it's fine. For a beginner this is great. I started off with Neewer in order to learn until my needs surpassed it's ability. Here's an example I did with this flash through an umbrella softbox, and Olympus entry MFT.
customer_reviews.author: arsallotTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Simple flash that does everything I need it to do without costing me a fortune. Has a good recycle time and definitely get bright enough for me. I have a few of these mounted on different softboxes in my shooting area and they have been performing just as good if not better than some of my more expensive units. Overall a steal for how much these cost, just make sure you know what kind of flash you're getting.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Huntington

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is a MANUAL flash. It is very inexpensive. However, it works great. I recommend it as a back-up/secondary flash for a pro or a flash for the hobbyist or student. When using full brightness it does lag a bit between shots but honestly, how often are you needing that much flash?
customer_reviews.author: H. CrockerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great flash for the price
customer_reviews.text: So I got this flash after my $550 canon took a dive to the cement and isn't working and I don't have the funds yet to fix. I wasn't sure about it at first but it is a great flash so far. It has some limitations but for the money it is great! The rotation of the flash doesn't seem to be as great as my canon but still functional. Sometimes I don't always tighten the attachement part the best but it still stays connected easily enough. I've always used manual flash so that wasn't a change. Great flash for the price. Wish I would have started with this, my canon has too many functions that I'm not utilizing.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina's World of Books

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly useful beginner's external flash
customer_reviews.text: I found it to be a solid, well-constructed piece of equipment. First time I ever used a non-built in flash for my growing camera kit and though it's a tad heavy with the four AA battery requirement, it wasn't so heavy that it was an issue. I found it perfect for shooting indoors in a dark bar setting even at its lowest brightness; flash temperature was perfectly soft as well and didn't wash out my subjects. Charges up quickly as well. This thing can get BRIIIIIIIGHT, so be warned about pumping up the intensity.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H

customer_reviews.title: My favorite speedlite!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this speedlite for several years for indoor weddings and events. I now own 4 of them and can do off-camera flash with attached triggers or on slave mode. My oldest one just recently broke (the head got stuck & wouldn't tilt anymore) but considering that it lasted over 4 years with heavy use, I consider it a great value and I didn't mind replacing it for $30! Many of my photographer friends are surprised to learn that I use a manual flash, especially because it has been more reliable than some of their name-brand TTL speedlites!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This baby is bright!! Even with a soft box I feel the highest setting is unnecessary; but it is better to have the option then be underpowered. I like that it has a small stand to allow it to sit elsewhere to flash light from another angle. Overall I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: This flash is absolutely wonderful. Got it specifically for an event I just shot at recently and it worked hard and incredibly well under pressure. Worked quick for fast paced movements and caught dancing and laughter well with ample lighting that suits it just right. So simple and easy to use both on or off my panasonic camera! They reacted together and formed a great team! Eight levels of power level adjustments so I can achieve bright as well as low lighting. So portable since it takes batteries, I love using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Not even kidding this is our favorite flash. We’ve been letting photographers for over eight ...
customer_reviews.text: Not even kidding this is our favorite flash. We’ve been letting photographers for over eight years and this gives such better light than my Nikon in a heartbeat! Seriously shoot it straight at the ceiling in the room with a ceiling and you will be blown away at HOW PRETTY IT IS. Works great for outdoors and tall ceilings too!!
customer_reviews.author: The Vagina Blog

customer_reviews.title: Learning as I go
customer_reviews.text: Great flash to learn on. Makes it easy to figure out how to use manual mode and get some cool shots in different lighted environments. This flash feels good overall and doesn’t really have any negatives as far as I can tell. If you're new to aftermarket flashes like me then i'd definitely suggest grabbing one of these to learn on.
customer_reviews.author: Reeves Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great manual flash for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners in flash photography. I love manual flashes and so far it works beautifully. Compatible with my Canon rebel xti AND my rebel t6i. I have not used it enough to attest to how long batteries last during a full night of flash photos. Good quality, great to learn flash on, easy to use, powerful flash, and inexpensive. It is a bit heavy though- thats my only gripe which I am sure universally applies to most speedlights.
customer_reviews.author: Rita L.

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a pro, however I love this speedlite
customer_reviews.text: Not having any training or much experience with photography I wanted a flash. The price was fantastic and as far I am concern it is a great product. Other flash unit were costing $100+, way to much for my casual use. Also picked up the Neewere 16 channel remote flash control so that the flash can be placed away from the camera. Love these products
customer_reviews.author: LT Xanax

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and dose a great job.
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 of them now. Its not expensive and a great product. Set it the way you like. Adjustable in different angles. Its always with me. Just make sure you use rechargeable batteries you can get from amazon for a decent price. or you will spend lots of money for regular batteries.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with batteries!
customer_reviews.text: It is a whole lot better than I thought it would be for the price...you can change-adjust how bright it flashes..on the brightest option it is extremely bright...you will not be disappointed with this product..I would buy it again if a had need for another one..and one more thing..it does NOT come with batteries..it takes 4 AA rechargeable batetties
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Great speedlight for photography
customer_reviews.text: This speedlight is so easy to use. It works so well and has all the basic functions aside from ttl. It is manual but I really like having full control of it. It also is a responsive slave so it flashes when it senses another flash go off. For the price this is awesome. I think every photographer should have a speedlight and for this price most can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good flash
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. But I’m sure their is better stuff out their. The flash is bright. All and all I would probably purchase again. But I gave it four stars because it’s bulky, and does not always flash when I want it to. A little hard to figure out at first.
customer_reviews.author: Sean F

customer_reviews.title: Wont find a better quality light for this price.
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price of this, I can't belive how nice it is and how well it works. The body is made tough and can take a beating, while stil remaining light and very bright. The bounce card works as intended and it mounts smoothly onto the hot shoe. The batteries seem to last a whole shoot for me without having to swap them out. I would still have extra batteries though for those emergency situations. Very nice quality with this speedlight and I wish I would have started using this sooner instead of wasting money on more expensive gear.
customer_reviews.author: Heller

customer_reviews.title: and it's a great flash. You don't need any of those expensive ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this flash with my GF-1 and my GX-1 for a long time now, and it's a great flash. You don't need any of those expensive Canon Speedlites - Neewer's works just as well and looks just as nice as those super expensive ones. It syncs well with other flashes in slave mode, or can control them itself. Plenty of settings and options to get that perfect lighting. I've used it to take photos of people for portraits, product photos, macro lighting, outdoor evenings with reflectors and so on. It's a versatile flash. Just wish it was a bit smaller - it's absolutely massive on any 4/3 lens system.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Great for starting out
customer_reviews.text: Never used an external flash before so this was very new to me. Luckily it was easy to figure out by just messing with it for a little bit, helping me learn how to use it and flashes in general. It feels solid, has a good weight to it and a good battery life. I haven't used it on any actual photo shoots yet, but I have been using it as much as I can to learn more and it has been the best learning tool at a very low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin Spear

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I have several Cannon brand DSLR cameras and needed a decent flash. This looked cheap, was bulky, and despite trying it on every camera I own, I could never get it to fire one single time. Bite the bullet and buy something worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Frank Jim John

customer_reviews.title: Great simple flash
customer_reviews.text: After attaching this flash to my special "Hot shoe" (controlled by an Arduino unit and relays), I easily adjusted the flash output to compensate for the flash to splash distance and started taking pictures. I know that if and when my "old" film camera flashes expire, they will be replaced with Neewer TT560 unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Bonsack

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy flash light for beginner use and this worked like a charm for an indoor event. Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: SOOOOO bright!
customer_reviews.text: This flash it so bright! I did a test in my dark basement and with the settings and this flash, I could see to the bottom of the stairs in pitch black! Tried it with the camera flash, and couldn't see more than a few feet down. So happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made a great gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter started getting into photography, so I decided to surprise her with this flash. I don't think I have ever seen her so excited. She uses it all the time and has shown me some photos she's taken with it. They look beautiful and she says that the flash is amazing. Even after using it all day it still has power so I would agree. Barely cost me anything and it has given so much joy. I would tell everyone to buy this if they are starting out with photography.
customer_reviews.author: Whitlock Fulk

customer_reviews.title: Was disappointed with response
customer_reviews.text: The flash would have been perfect for the camera if I could have got a cable to connect it to my camera. When I tried contacting their company they didn’t respond even though the paperwork inside the flash pleaded not to give a bad review.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Kleczek

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, great speed lite/flash!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a landscape photographer interested in doing sunset portraits, and this speed lite really helped! It's the first time I've used a speed lite, and I am very glad I purchased this one, in particular! It is inexpensive and easy to use, in my opinion. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Roya Oshrieh

customer_reviews.title: I'm admittedly a pretty amateur photographer
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing is incredibly. I'm admittedly a pretty amateur photographer, so for me it was a huge step up to go from my Nikon D5100's built-in flash to a speedlite. I can't compare this to high end flashes, but I felt like this gave me a lot more versatility and brightness than I've ever had the chance to work with before. I do wish that I had a little bit more control over brightness variation on the lower end of the scale, but this is a minor hangup in an otherwise great product. I'd definitely recommend it to friends/family who wanted to try out a speedlite for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Possum

customer_reviews.title: I really love this flash
customer_reviews.text: I really love this flash. It works very well and I have already recommended it to a friend. Nice quality for a good price! Works great with my Canon Rebel T6i. At first I couldn't get it to work but I didn't realize that "live view" had to be disabled for it to work. Once I figured that out, the flash worked great! It also works great off camera in slave mode on my umbrella stand as a strobe. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Delta Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Affordable flash that is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great affordable flash that gets the job done. Not only is this thing bright but it is so easy to use. Its menu functions are simple and it was able to connect with my camera right away. I have only used it a few times since I got it but it has definitely been fun to learn about flashes a bit and it makes my pictures look a lot more professional.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Simmons

customer_reviews.title: A good inexpensive flash
customer_reviews.text: This is a remarkably good, inexpensive speedlite type flash unit. It works equally well on my Canon DSLR camera and my Sony A6000 mirrorless camera. With this flash you have to manually adjust the light intensity; something I learned to do quite quickly. Canon's speedlite flash, attached to a Canon camera, can adjust light intensity automatically but will cost much more than the Neewer TT560 flash. Is the extra cost of the Canon flash worth it? I think buying an expensive Canon flash is not necessary for most people who use a flash only occasionally, which is true in my case. For me the Neewer unit was a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: L. Farwell

customer_reviews.title: Not for a Canon T3i as stated.
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT work with a Canon T3i camera as stated. You have to hold it in place to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: this little flash works amazingly
customer_reviews.text: This manual flash worked really well with neon lighting. I wasn't quite sure how it would react with it or if the colors would still even show up but when I saw the pictures in the reviews from other customers I knew this flash would be a good fit for me. The bulb is tiltable so I can direct the lighting where I please and it even has a built in diffuser that can slide right out and lessen the harshness entirely. Gives me amazing photos with my Pentax.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Phillips

customer_reviews.title: This prouduct is terrible
customer_reviews.text: This flash would never work with my flash on my camera the only time it would work is if you pushed "test"..
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Goff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget flash
customer_reviews.text: Excellent no frills flash. Very powerful and ok speed on recycling. I liked that the controls are dead simple. On/off and Power up/down. The only bad thing is I wish they label the power levels. You have to count the lights to determine where you're at. The flash is manual only, no TTL support. TIPS: This flash uses a standard hotshoe so you should be able to use it on any camera except some old Sony/Minoltas. The flash will recycle faster with rechargeable batteries. Rechargeable batteries last longer per charge too. The Yongnuo YN560IV will recycle about twice as fast but the power output appears to be the same. It does cost over twice as much though.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed that for the price I got such a well made flash. I switched from Nikon to canon and needed a flash for a shoot asap. Thought I’d use this until my canon flash arrived since it was prime and would get here sooner. It worked so well I haven’t even used my canon one.
customer_reviews.author: Photogal

product_meta.title: Neewer TT560 Flash Speedlite for Canon Nikon Panasonic Olympus Pentax and Other DSLR Cameras，Digital Cameras with Standard Hot Shoe
product_meta.description: Power Management: Switch to the ON the flash will start charging (the charging indicator is dim).
feature_bullets: Vertical Rotation Angle: 0~90 degrees, Horizontal Rotation Angle: 0~270 degrees; Note: Don't support TTL and the camera menu setting Function

Compatible with for Canon Nikon Panasonic Olympus Pentax Fijifilm and Sony with Mi Hot Shoe cameras，like a9 a7 a7II a7III a7R III a7RII a7SII a6000 a6300 a6500 (NOT compatible with Canon EOS Rebel SL3/250D，Rebel T7/1500D 2000D，Rebel T100/3000D 4000D）
Power Management: Switch to the ON, the flash will start charging (the charging indicator is dim)
For a test flash, press the test button. After use, press the ON/OFF to OFF to power off.
Red charging indicator lamp flickers in every 1s; it indicates low battery; The flash unit has 8 steps of power output control which indicated by 8 pieces of LED

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,018 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
